meanings.definition: Organize according to a systematic plan.
meanings.sent1: She likes to methodise her study notes to keep them neat and easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: He decided to methodise his daily routine to be more productive.
meanings.sent3: Trying to methodise a chaotic room can be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: She methodised her thoughts like putting puzzle pieces together.
meanings.sent5: Methodising your tasks can help you stay on track and achieve your goals.

meanings.sent1: The librarian will methodise the books on the shelves alphabetically.
meanings.sent2: He likes to methodise his closet by color and type of clothing.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing to watch him methodise his collection of action figures.
meanings.sent4: She methodised the ingredients for the recipe like a scientist in a lab.
meanings.sent5: Methodising your belongings can save you time when looking for things.
